Gisborne’s significant improvement in New Year driver behaviour https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/gisbornes-significant-improvement-in-new-year-driver-behaviour/WBA3W22HVNBURDY3D2TO2OY37Y/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/gisbornes-significant-improvement-in-new-year-driver-behaviour/WBA3W22HVNBURDY3D2TO2OY37Y/ Tairāwhiti police were pleased with the behaviour of visitors and locals over New Year. Wed, 01 Jan 2025 22:40:38 +0000 Police at the checkpoint outside Rhythm and Vines on New Year's Day. Nearly 6000 drivers were tested for alcohol, resulting in 13 people being summoned to appear in court for driving with an excess breath or blood alcohol level. Fifteen infringement notices were issued.
